title: China and Fiji cooperate on police training in 2011 (Linked to Projects #39407, #49130, #90311, #90312, Project #90310)
description: On April 18, 2011, China Ministry of Public Security signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Fiji's Ministry of Defence, National Security and Policing about police cooperation on anti-terrorism and anti-crime. According to the MoU, the two sides will provide training of police personnel and meeting of working groups, and will also have technical cooperation in police science and the technology of police equipment. The MoU has an effective period of 5 years.  This project is ongoing and trainings provided by China include: Project #39407: second attachment of officers in 2013 Project #49130: third attachment of officers in 2015 Project #90311: fourth attachment of officers in 2016 Project #90312: fifth attachment of officers in 2017 Project #90310: sixth attachment of officers in 2018  Trainings are conducted by China's the Ministry of Public Security, and by 2015 around 60 Fijian officers had participated in training exchanges. In 2017, the MoU was extended for a further five years, and another batch of Fijian officers was invited by the Ministry of Public Security to attend training in Hubei Province. Equipment worth FJD 670,000 was also donated to the police force at that time (see Project #64696).
staff_comments: The MoU is also known as 2011中斐警务合作谅解备忘录 or 中华人民共和国公安部和斐济群岛共和国国防、国家安全与移民部合作谅解备忘录
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China and Fiji cooperate on police training in 2011 (Linked to Projects #39407, #49130, #90311, #90312, Project #90310)

# Description
On April 18, 2011, China Ministry of Public Security signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Fiji's Ministry of Defence, National Security and Policing about police cooperation on anti-terrorism and anti-crime. According to the MoU, the two sides will provide training of police personnel and meeting of working groups, and will also have technical cooperation in police science and the technology of police equipment. The MoU has an effective period of 5 years.  This project is ongoing and trainings provided by China include: Project #39407: second attachment of officers in 2013 Project #49130: third attachment of officers in 2015 Project #90311: fourth attachment of officers in 2016 Project #90312: fifth attachment of officers in 2017 Project #90310: sixth attachment of officers in 2018  Trainings are conducted by China's the Ministry of Public Security, and by 2015 around 60 Fijian officers had participated in training exchanges. In 2017, the MoU was extended for a further five years, and another batch of Fijian officers was invited by the Ministry of Public Security to attend training in Hubei Province. Equipment worth FJD 670,000 was also donated to the police force at that time (see Project #64696).
justification: Project focuses on police training and cooperation, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Police training and technical cooperation, equipment donation, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Government donates FJD 4.1 millon worth of construction and civil engineering equipment to the Royal Fijian Military Forces
description: On January 4, 2011, the Chinese Government donated 24 pieces of machinery worth FJD 4.1 million to the Royal Fijian Military Forces (RFMF) Engineers Regiment for development activities. The donation included 4 excavators; 5 dump trucks; 3 bulldozers, 2 vibratory rollers; 1 pneumatic roller; 2 motor graders; 2 wheel loaders; 2 loader diggers; 1 water truck; 1 pickup; 1 truck with a crane. The machinery will be used for rural development work. A team of technicians from China provided training. XCMG Construction Machinery Co., Ltd is the implementing agency.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
Chinese Government donates FJD 4.1 millon worth of construction and civil engineering equipment to the Royal Fijian Military Forces

# Description
On January 4, 2011, the Chinese Government donated 24 pieces of machinery worth FJD 4.1 million to the Royal Fijian Military Forces (RFMF) Engineers Regiment for development activities. The donation included 4 excavators; 5 dump trucks; 3 bulldozers, 2 vibratory rollers; 1 pneumatic roller; 2 motor graders; 2 wheel loaders; 2 loader diggers; 1 water truck; 1 pickup; 1 truck with a crane. The machinery will be used for rural development work. A team of technicians from China provided training. XCMG Construction Machinery Co., Ltd is the implementing agency.
justification: Donation of construction equipment for rural development work without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction and civil engineering equipment donation, rural development focus

title: Chinese Government hosts China workshop for Fijian officials
description: On October 31, 2011, the Chinese Embassy held a symposium and reception for the 2011 China Workshop for Fijian trainees. Twenty participating officials from 15 government departments in Fiji, 5 Fiji human resource development officials, and some Fiji civil servant training officials were invited to attend. The trainees fully exchanged their learning experience in China during the forum.  Chinese Ambassador to Fiji Huang Yong and Fiji Public Service Commission Permanent Secretary Chan De attended the reception and delivered speeches. This training is part of ongoing China-Fiji human resources cooperation.
staff_comments: The start date of the training workshop in China is unknown.

evidence: Symposium and reception for Fijian officials, human resources cooperation focus

title: Chinese Government provides $8 million interest-free loan for Friendship Stadium Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#60752, #60753, and #60470)
description: On November 7, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an RMB 30 million grant for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project and other unspecified projects. Then, on December 22, 2009, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an RMB 50 million interest-free loan for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project. Then, on December 13, 2010, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an additional RMB 80 million interest-free loan for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project. In 2011, the Chinese Government also reportedly provided an additional $8 million interest-free loan for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project.    Project ID#60470 captures the RMB 30 million grant. Project ID#60752 captures the RMB 50 million interest-free loan. Project ID#60753 captures the RMB 80 million interest-free loan. Project ID#517 captures the $8 million interest-free loan.   The Friendship Stadium Construction Project involved the construction of a 40,000 seat stadium in Angondjé, a suburb of Libreville in Gabon. It also involved the construction of seven ticket offices, an athletic track meeting international standards, and a soccer field. This stadium is known as Stade de l’Amitié and le Stade de l'amitié sino-gabonaise. Shanghai Construction Group was the contractor responsible for implementation. It signed a $90 million construction contract on August 4, 2009 and it reportedly hired more than 600 Chinese employees. Construction began on January 23, 2010 and ended November 16, 2011. Then, on November 27, 2011, an official project handover ceremony and stadium opening ceremony was held. The stadium was completed in advance of the 2012 African Cup of Nations.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 中加友谊体育场. The French project title is Stade de l’Amitié and le Stade de l'amitié sino-gabonaise.  One source suggests that that Chinese Government contributed 46 million euros to this project. However, it is unclear how this estimate was derived.   Since loan terms for the interest-free loan are unavailable, AidData has set maturity period to 20 years by default and grace period to 10 years by default per China's Foreign Assistance White Paper (http://www.cidca.gov.cn/2018-08/06/c_129925064_3.htm) which states that the maturity period of interest-free loans is 20 years, with a drawdown period of 5 years, grace period of 5 years, and repayment over 10 years. AidData treats the drawdown period as providing 5 years of additional grace.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides $8 million interest-free loan for Friendship Stadium Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#60752, #60753, and #60470)

# Description
On November 7, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an RMB 30 million grant for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project and other unspecified projects. Then, on December 22, 2009, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an RMB 50 million interest-free loan for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project. Then, on December 13, 2010, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed an additional RMB 80 million interest-free loan for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project. In 2011, the Chinese Government also reportedly provided an additional $8 million interest-free loan for the Friendship Stadium Construction Project.    Project ID#60470 captures the RMB 30 million grant. Project ID#60752 captures the RMB 50 million interest-free loan. Project ID#60753 captures the RMB 80 million interest-free loan. Project ID#517 captures the $8 million interest-free loan.   The Friendship Stadium Construction Project involved the construction of a 40,000 seat stadium in Angondjé, a suburb of Libreville in Gabon. It also involved the construction of seven ticket offices, an athletic track meeting international standards, and a soccer field. This stadium is known as Stade de l’Amitié and le Stade de l'amitié sino-gabonaise. Shanghai Construction Group was the contractor responsible for implementation. It signed a $90 million construction contract on August 4, 2009 and it reportedly hired more than 600 Chinese employees. Construction began on January 23, 2010 and ended November 16, 2011. Then, on November 27, 2011, an official project handover ceremony and stadium opening ceremony was held. The stadium was completed in advance of the 2012 African Cup of Nations.
justification: Project is focused on stadium construction without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 40,000 seat stadium with associated facilities, primarily for social and sporting purposes

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 850 million government concessional loan for Libreville Electricity Network Renovation Project
description: On February 12, 2011, China Eximbank and the Government of Gabon signed an RMB 850 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Libreville Electricity Network Renovation Project. The loan was then approved by Gabon's President and Council of Ministers on February 21, 2013. The GCL carries a 20 year maturity and a 2.5% interest rate. The proceeds of the loan were used by the borrower to finance a 2009 commercial contract between Sinohydro Engineering Bureau 4 Co. Ltd and Gabon’s Ministry of Energy and Water Resources and the Ministry of Economy and Trade.   The project involved the construction of a substation in Angondje, the expansion of two substations in Ambowe and Bissegué, and the construction three overhead transmission lines and two underground cable transmission lines measuring 130 km in length.   Sinohydro Engineering Bureau 4 Co. Ltd was the contractor responsible for implementation. Its ultimate objective was to better connect Libreville to surrounding areas. Its work was overseen by the Electricity Office of Energy and Hydraulic Resources Department of the Government of Gabon. The project officially commenced on June 10, 2011. As of May 2014, the new substation in Angondje, the expansion of the two substations in Ambowe (Ntoum) and Bissegué, and the construction of a 23 km underground cable transmission line from Ambowe to Owendo (connecting to the Ambowe-Owendo power plant) were completed. Although this project was completed, it precise completion date is unknown.  There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Libreville Electricity Network Renovation Project may have financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender.  In mid-2014, a decline in international oil prices generated sharp reductions in Gabon’s oil exports and fiscal revenues. The country’s rising fiscal deficit led to the accumulation of arrears to external creditors. By 2017, the stock of the Government of Gabon’s external arrears stood at $115 million, including arrears to China, Canada, Germany, Spain, France, Israel, and South Korea. All of these arrears were successfully cleared by 2020. However, the Government of Gabon accumulated $3 million of additional arrears to Chinese creditors in 2020.  By the end of May 2021, ‘the stock of [the Government of] Gabon’s external arrears stood at CFAF 98.03 billion (US$182.1 million), including CFAF 23.8 billion (US$44.2 million) vis-à-vis multilaterals and CFAF 21.05 billion (US$39.1 million) vis-à-vis government agencies and private creditors insured with companies from Paris Club member countries and from China [ICBC and China Construction Bank] CFAF 1.3 billion (US$2.42 million). The Government's strategy for the clearance of existing external arrears consists of focusing primarily on multilateral debt, bilateral debt, insured commercial commitments and seeking agreements with other creditors prior to the IMF Board meeting. Accordingly, we will clear the arrears vis-à-vis the multilaterals. We will also clear bilateral and commercial-insured arrears as follows: (i) Austria CFAF 6.83 billion (US$12.69 million); (ii) France CFAF 11.9 billion (US$22.11 million); (iii) Israel CFAF 2.23 billion (US$4.13 million); and Spain CFAF 0.09 billion (US$0.17 million). Regarding the other commercial arrears vis-à-cis AFREXIMBANK (CFAF 7.52 billion or US$13.97 million, and commercial non-insured vis-à-vis France CFAF 0.7 billion (US$1.24 million), Austria CFAF 8.71 billion (US$16.18 million), and Morocco CFAF 1.01 billion (US$1.87 million), we contacted these creditors individually to obtain from them the non-objection agreement. The same communication was made with China to which our bilateral payment arrears are about CFAF 34.01 billion (US$63.17 million).’ Then, in 2022, the IMF reported that the Government of Gabon’s external arrears to Chinese creditors stood at $23.9 million as of December 2021 and $1 million in June 2022.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Libreville Power Grid Upgrade Project and Libreville Electric Network Renovation Project. The French project title is Transport Énergie Électrique or Sécurisation du réseau électrique de Libreville. The Chinese project title is 利伯维尔地区电力输送网络安全工程 or 加蓬电网改造项目 or 加蓬利伯维尔地区城市电网改造项目

The loan was then approved by Gabon's President and Council of Ministers on February 21, 2013. The GCL carries a 20 year maturity and a 2.5% interest rate. The proceeds of the loan were used by the borrower to finance a 2009 commercial contract between Sinohydro Engineering Bureau 4 Co. The project involved the construction of a substation in Angondje, the expansion of two substations in Ambowe and Bissegué, and the construction three overhead transmission lines and two underground cable transmission lines measuring 130 km in length. Its work was overseen by the Electricity Office of Energy and Hydraulic Resources Department of the Government of Gabon. The project officially commenced on June 10, 2011. Although this project was completed, it precise completion date is unknown. Regarding the other commercial arrears vis-à-cis AFREXIMBANK (CFAF 7.52 billion or US$13.97 million, and commercial non-insured vis-à-vis France CFAF 0.7 billion (US$1.24 million), Austria CFAF 8.71 billion (US$16.18 million), and Morocco CFAF 1.01 billion (US$1.87 million), we contacted these creditors individually to obtain from them the non-objection agreement. The same communication was made with China to which our bilateral payment arrears are about CFAF 34.01 billion (US$63.17 million).’ Then, in 2022, the IMF reported that the Government of Gabon’s external arrears to Chinese creditors stood at $23.9 million as of December 2021 and $1 million in June 2022.
justification: Project focuses on electricity network renovation and expansion, which is essential infrastructure but has an indirect relationship to energy transition
evidence: Construction of substations, expansion of existing substations, and construction of transmission lines totaling 130 km in length

title: Chinese Government dispatches 17th medical team to Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital in Libreville and Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville
description: Since 1977, Tianjin Province has been sending medical teams to Gabon. On July 28, 2011, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 17th Chinese medical team to Gabon. The team was stationed at the Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital (Hôpital de la Coopération Sino-Gabonaise de Libreville) in the city of Libreville and the Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital (Hopital de L'amitie Sino Gabonaise) in the town of Franceville. The team completed its term of service between 2011 and 2013.  The mission includes a team of 15 professionals in all medical specialties that will carry out diagnostic and therapeutic activities  and train staff in the Sino-Gabonese hospitals of Bellevis in Libreville and of the Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville. As part of the agreement, the Chinese government will annually donate drugs and medical supplies to the two hospitals.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 17th medical team to Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital in Libreville and Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville

# Description
Since 1977, Tianjin Province has been sending medical teams to Gabon. On July 28, 2011, the Chinese Government and the Government of Gabon signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 17th Chinese medical team to Gabon. The team was stationed at the Sino-Gabonese Cooperation Hospital (Hôpital de la Coopération Sino-Gabonaise de Libreville) in the city of Libreville and the Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital (Hopital de L'amitie Sino Gabonaise) in the town of Franceville. The team completed its term of service between 2011 and 2013.  The mission includes a team of 15 professionals in all medical specialties that will carry out diagnostic and therapeutic activities  and train staff in the Sino-Gabonese hospitals of Bellevis in Libreville and of the Sino-Gabonese Friendship Hospital in Franceville. As part of the agreement, the Chinese government will annually donate drugs and medical supplies to the two hospitals.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services and medical training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment, diagnostic and therapeutic activities, staff training, donation of drugs and medical supplies

title: Chinese Government signs 60 billion CFA franc loan agreement in 2011
description: In 2011, the governments of Gabon and China signed a loan agreement of 60 billion CFA francs (around 95 million euros) for the modernization and strengthening of the electricity network of the Gabonese capital. It is also about securing the transport network of Libreville and its region. More details of the loan and its current status are unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title

# Description
In 2011, the governments of Gabon and China signed a loan agreement of 60 billion CFA francs (around 95 million euros) for the modernization and strengthening of the electricity network of the Gabonese capital. It is also about securing the transport network of Libreville and its region. More details of the loan and its current status are unknown.
justification: Project focuses on electricity network modernization and strengthening, which is grid infrastructure
evidence: Modernization and strengthening of electricity network, securing transport network of Libreville

title: Chinese Government provides a RMB 60 million grant — via an ETCA — for the Greenhouse Complex Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#67762)
description: On December 20, 2011, the Chinese Government and the Government of Georgia signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), in which the Chinese Government committed RMB 60 million ($9,468,000 USD) of grant funding for a Greenhouse Complex Construction Project. The proceeds from this grant were used to purchase agricultural machinery/equipment for vegetable cultivation in greenhouses and improve the delivery of land melioration services. The Chinese Ministry of Commerce provided the grant.  The project took place on a 5 hectare plot of land at the LEPL Scientific-Research Center of the Ministry of Agriculture of Georgia in Marneuli district (municipality) within Kvemo Kartli region. It involved the construction of 6 large, solar and 27 small, simpler greenhouses, micro irrigation facilities, and other associated infrastructure. The ultimate goal of the project was to increase vegetable production in Georgia. Hunan Agriculture Group Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for project implementation.  The project commenced in April 2015 and was it was originally expected to reach completion in October 2017. However, it ultimately reached completion on December 31, 2017.  The Chinese Government later provided a RMB 20 million grant in 2014 to train Georgian farmers at the greenhouses financed by this project. For this related project, see linked project ID#67762.
staff_comments: The Chinese title for the project is 援格鲁吉亚蔬菜大棚种植技术合作项目. In the Government of Georgia’s External Assistance Management Information System (EAMIS), this project is called the ‘Purchase of agricultural machinery/equipment (for green-house vegetables cultivation; also, to improve the delivery of land melioration services in Georgia) for the Ministry of Agriculture of Georgia’. The Georgian project title is საქართველოს სოფლის მეურნეობის სამინისტროსთვის შესაბამისი ტექნიკისა და აღჭურვილობის შეძენა(სასათბურე მეურნეობის განვითარებისთვის,ასევე, მელიორაციის მომსახურების მიწოდების გასაუმჯობესებლად).
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides a RMB 60 million grant — via an ETCA — for the Greenhouse Complex Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#67762)

# Description
On December 20, 2011, the Chinese Government and the Government of Georgia signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), in which the Chinese Government committed RMB 60 million ($9,468,000 USD) of grant funding for a Greenhouse Complex Construction Project. The proceeds from this grant were used to purchase agricultural machinery/equipment for vegetable cultivation in greenhouses and improve the delivery of land melioration services. The Chinese Ministry of Commerce provided the grant.  The project took place on a 5 hectare plot of land at the LEPL Scientific-Research Center of the Ministry of Agriculture of Georgia in Marneuli district (municipality) within Kvemo Kartli region. It involved the construction of 6 large, solar and 27 small, simpler greenhouses, micro irrigation facilities, and other associated infrastructure. The ultimate goal of the project was to increase vegetable production in Georgia. Hunan Agriculture Group Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for project implementation.  The project commenced in April 2015 and was it was originally expected to reach completion in October 2017. However, it ultimately reached completion on December 31, 2017.  The Chinese Government later provided a RMB 20 million grant in 2014 to train Georgian farmers at the greenhouses financed by this project. For this related project, see linked project ID#67762.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural development and greenhouse construction without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Greenhouse complex construction, agricultural machinery/equipment, vegetable cultivation, micro irrigation facilities

title: Chinese Government donates sporting equipment to Ghana’s Ministry for Youth and Sports
description: On June 21, 2011, China donated a variety of sports equipment to Ghana's Minister for Youth and Sports. The equipment included basketballs, footballs, volleyball posts and nets, table tennis tables and bats and badminton posts and nets. The value of this donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government donates sporting equipment to Ghana’s Ministry for Youth and Sports

# Description
On June 21, 2011, China donated a variety of sports equipment to Ghana's Minister for Youth and Sports. The equipment included basketballs, footballs, volleyball posts and nets, table tennis tables and bats and badminton posts and nets. The value of this donation is unknown.
justification: Project involves donation of sports equipment with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of sports equipment to Ghana's Ministry for Youth and Sports, categorized under social infrastructure and services

title: China Development Bank provides $1.5 million loan to build Africa Program of China Europe International Business School (CEIBS)
description: In 2011, the China Development Bank signed a $1.5 million loan agreement with the China Europe International Business School to help it build an “Africa Program” in Ghana. This program was designed to improve the management capabilities of African companies. The implementation status of this project is unknown. CEIBS was established under an agreement between the Chinese government and the European Commission in Shanghai in November 1994. It was the first business school in mainland China to offer a full-time MBA, an Executive MBA and a wide range of Executive Education program. CEIBS follows the European model of business schools and its MBA program has consistently ranked amongst the best in the world. In May 2009 CEIBS started an Executive MBA program in Ghana.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
In 2011, the China Development Bank signed a $1.5 million loan agreement with the China Europe International Business School to help it build an “Africa Program” in Ghana. This program was designed to improve the management capabilities of African companies. The implementation status of this project is unknown. CEIBS was established under an agreement between the Chinese government and the European Commission in Shanghai in November 1994. It was the first business school in mainland China to offer a full-time MBA, an Executive MBA and a wide range of Executive Education program. CEIBS follows the European model of business schools and its MBA program has consistently ranked amongst the best in the world. In May 2009 CEIBS started an Executive MBA program in Ghana.
justification: Project focuses on education and management training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Loan for building Africa Program of business school, aimed at improving management capabilities of African companies
